content: The "Making Adoption Affordable Act of 2012" is cited as the short title. Expanded tax benefits for adoption are made permanent. The "Making Adoption Affordable Act of 2012" made expansions enacted in 2001 permanent and expansions enacted in 2010 permanently reinstated, including an increase in the dollar limitation for the adoption credit. The dollar limitation in section 23(b) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is increased from $10,000 to $13,170. Additionally, the $10,000 credit for adoption of a child with special needs is also increased to $13,170. The dollar limitation in section 23(b) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is increased to $13,170 for adoption of a child with special needs, with a conforming amendment for inflation adjustments. The dollar limitations in subsections (a)(3) and (b)(1) of the Internal Revenue Code will be increased for taxable years starting after December 31, 2010, based on the cost-of-living adjustment determined for the calendar year. The dollar amount for taxable years starting after December 31, 2002, will be adjusted based on the cost-of-living adjustment determined for the calendar year, rounded to the nearest multiple of $10 if necessary. For taxable years starting after December 31, 2002, the dollar amount in subsection (b)(2)(A)(i) will be increased by the cost-of-living adjustment for that calendar year, rounded to the nearest multiple of $10 if needed. For taxable years starting after December 31, 2002, the dollar amount in subsection (b)(2)(A)(i) will be increased under section 1(f)(3) for the calendar year in which the taxable year begins, determined by substituting 'calendar year 2001' for 'calendar year 1992'. If the increased amount is not a multiple of $10, it shall be rounded to the nearest multiple of $10.
